ygData.subject: Re: Digest Number 560
ygData.msgSnippet: Actually, my friend I think you are mistaken.  I m pretty sure I have read even Brad say that selo s originally was supposed to break root.  Now, it doesn t
ygData.messageBody:
Actually, my friend I think you are mistaken. I'm
pretty sure I have read even Brad say that selo's
originally was supposed to break root. Now, it
doesn't probably because the sow folks complained that
bards were too powerful which is BS.

Anyway, I got rooted last night by something and I
couldn't break it by starting up selo's. It did,
however, work against my wizard friend's root. Or at
least it appeared to. And this was by starting up
selo's AFTER the root was in place. Since he is 4
levels higher than me I'd be surprised if I was
breaking it on my own with some strange magic
resistance that I don't know of.

Thex Luteslinger (Tunare)

>
> Message: 9
> Date: Thu, 02 Dec 1999 23:45:06 +0000
> From: "M Sanford (Maev)" <pr0teus@...>
> Subject: Re: Un-Broken Song
>
> This IS a bug. Its so obvious accelerando wasnt mean
> to break root and ghoul root. Moving around while
> there's still the root icon on your screen? Being
> rooted after you zone? This is a bug and always has
> been, and using it to break root is exploiting (not
> that it really matters to Verant). But I wish bards
> would quit treating this as a nifty feature and
> acknowledge it as a bug. So technically the song is
> not
> "un-broken" as you say.
>
> Maev Lorekeeper
> Tarew Marr
>
